intro: Paracaryum tibeticum, commonly known as the Tibetan paracaryum, is a species of flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Tibet. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants commonly known as buckwheats. The plant is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of small, greenish-yellow flowers. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Paracaryum tibeticum is adapted to high-altitude environments, exhibiting resilience to cold and strong winds.
